alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 05 at 4:17PM CDT until June 05 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Phillips County in north central Kansas... Northern Rooks County in north central Kansas... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 417 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Stockton and Woodston. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stockton and Woodston. This includes the following streams and drainages... Dibble Creek, Ash Creek, Borin Creek, Lost Creek, Bow Creek, East Branch Jim Creek, Boxelder Creek, Jim Creek, Cocklebur Creek, Sand Creek, Douglas Creek, Elm Creek and Medicine Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
